SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am11
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am11.model.players.field

Class PlayerField

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am11.model.players.field.PlayerField
public class PlayerField extends Object
The PlayerField class represents the field of a player in the game.

It manages the positioning and exposure of cards on the field.

The class contains two main parts: an ExposedItemManager and a PositionManager.

The ExposedItemManager is responsible for managing the items exposed in the field.

The PositionManager is responsible for managing the positions of the cards on the field.

The class provides methods for placing cards on the field, checking the availability of positions, getting the number of specific items exposed on the field, and checking if a card is present on the field.

It also provides methods for saving and loading the state of the field.

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerField

      public PlayerField()

  • Method Details

    • clearAll

      public void clearAll()
      Resets the PlayerField to its initial state.

      This method calls the reset method on both the ExposedItemManager and the PositionManager. The itemManager's reset method clears all exposed items on the PlayerField. The positionManager's reset method clears all positioned cards on the PlayerField.

    • placeStartingCard

      public void placeStartingCard (@NotNull @NotNull StarterCard firstCard, boolean isRetro) throws IllegalCardPlacingException
      Places a StarterCard on the PlayerField at the starter position (0,0).

      This method first positions the card. Then, it updates the exposed items. The method does not return any points as the placement of a StarterCard does not yield any points.

      Parameters:
      firstCard - The StarterCard to be placed on the PlayerField.
      isRetro - A boolean indicating whether the card is placed in retro mode.
      Throws:
      IllegalCardPlacingException - If an attempt is made to place a StarterCard more than once.

    • place

      public int place (@NotNull @NotNull PlayableCard card, @NotNull @NotNull Position position, boolean isRetro) throws IllegalCardPlacingException
      Places a PlayableCard on the PlayerField at a specified Position.

      The starter position is defined as (0, 0).

      If the provided position matches the starter position, an IllegalCardPlacingException is thrown, indicating that a PlayableCard cannot be placed in the starter position.

      Then, it positions the card and updates the exposed items. Finally, it returns the points gained from placing the card.

      Parameters:
      card - The PlayableCard to be placed on the PlayerField.
      position - The Position at which the card is to be placed.
      isRetro - A boolean indicating whether the card is placed in retro mode.
      Returns:
      The points gained from placing the card.
      Throws:
      IllegalCardPlacingException - If an attempt is made to place a PlayableCard in the starter position or the position in unavailable.

    • getAvailablePositions

      public Set<Position> getAvailablePositions()
      It is used to get a set of all available positions on the player's field.

      The availability of a position is determined by the PositionManager.

      A position is considered available if it is not occupied by a card, and it is adjacent to a card already placed on the field.

      Returns:
      A set of all available positions on the player's field.

    • isAvailable

      public boolean isAvailable (@NotNull @NotNull Position position)
      It is used to check if a specific position on the player's field is available.

      The availability of a position is determined by the PositionManager.

      A position is considered available if it is not occupied by a card, and it is adjacent to a card already placed on the field.

      Parameters:
      position - Position - The position to check for availability.
      Returns:
      boolean - True if the position is available, false otherwise.

    • getNumberOf

      public int getNumberOf (@NotNull @NotNull Item item)
      It is used to get the number of a specific item exposed on the player's field.

      The item is specified by the parameter passed to the method.

      The number of specific items is determined by the ExposedItemManager.

      Parameters:
      item - Item - The item for which to get the count.
      Returns:
      int - The number of the specified item exposed on the player's field.

    • containsCard

      public boolean containsCard (@NotNull @NotNull FieldCard card)
      It is used to check if a specific card is present on the player's field.

      The presence of a card is determined by the PositionManager.

      Parameters:
      card - FieldCard - The card to check for presence on the field.
      Returns:
      boolean - True if the card is present on the field, false otherwise.

    • getCardsPositioned

      public Map<Position,CardContainer> getCardsPositioned()
      It is used to get the map of cards positioned on the player's field.
      Returns:
      Map - A map of cards positioned on the player's field.

    • getPlacedCardColours

      public Map<GameColor,Integer> getPlacedCardColours()
      It is used to get the number of "placed" colors in the player's field.
      Returns:
      Map - A map of colors and the number of exposed items of that color.

    • getNumberOfPositionedColor

      public int getNumberOfPositionedColor (@NotNull @NotNull GameColor color)
      It is used to get the number of items of a specific color exposed on the player's field.
      Parameters:
      color - GameColor - The color for which to get the count.
      Returns:
      int - The number of items of the specified color exposed on the player's field.

    • isRequirementMet

      public boolean isRequirementMet (@NotNull @NotNull FieldCard card, boolean isRetro)
      It is used to check if the requirements for placing a specific card on the player's field are met.

      The requirements are determined by the ExposedItemManager.

      For a StarterCard, the method always returns true as there are no requirements for placing a StarterCard.

      For a PlayableCard, the method checks the requirements of the card.

      Parameters:
      card - FieldCard - The card to check for requirement satisfaction.
      isRetro - boolean - A flag indicating whether the card is placed in retro mode.
      Returns:
      boolean - True if the requirements for placing the card are met, false otherwise.

    • save

      @NotNull public @NotNull FieldMemento save()
      It is used to save the current state of the player's field.

      The state of the player's field includes the state of the ExposedItemManager and the PositionManager.

      Returns:
      FieldMemento - A FieldMemento object representing the current state of the player's field.

    • load

      public void load (@NotNull @NotNull FieldMemento memento)
      It is used to load a saved state of the player's field.

      The state of the player's field includes the state of the ExposedItemManager and the PositionManager.

      Parameters:
      memento - FieldMemento - The state to load into the player's field.
